text: Hello everyone. I am facing some issues with "Writing, Building, and Running Chaincode in a Development Environment".  I am using a  Ubuntu 14.04 LTS system, followed the steps given under without vagrant (docker images).
When I try to deploy the chaincode using "peer chaincode deploy -n mycc -c '{"Args": ["init", "a","100", "b", "200"]}'"
I am getting a "peer command not found" error.
<@U11QC59MY>  If you are using docker images, then you have to login to the bash shell of running docker instance and then execute those commands.
<@U1CS08EP3>   So the chaincode registration step also needs to be inside docker right?
The peer executable is available only inside the docker's bash shell. So yes.

<@U11QC59MY> You have to build the Chaincode executable inside the docker I guess. Because the go environment, outside the docker, i.e, present in the host OS and the one present inside the docker might be different.
<@U1CS08EP3>  Thanks for the help. I will try this and get back to you.
